Interface ConnectFourGame

All Known Implementing Classes:
ConnectFour
public interface ConnectFourGame
A Connect 4 game interface. Connect 4 is a two-player game where each player tries to make a straight line (vertical, horizontal, or diagonal) of four of their colored checkers by dropping their checkers into a 6 x 7 grid. The ConnectFourGame interface provides methods for client to set two players, make move(choose a column to drop a checker every round), get current player, get the game status and get a deep copy of the board data array.

  • Method Details

    • makeMove

      void makeMove​(int column)
      Allow a player to drop a checker into a specified column. Check if there is a winner after the player make a move and switch to another player.
      Parameters:
      column - into which the player drop a checker, integer, [1, 7] inclusive.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - when 1.the column is full 2.the column specified is out of range.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      ConnectFourGame.Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Get current player for the next move.
      Returns:
      Player object.

    • getStatus

      ConnectFourGame.Status getStatus()
      Get current game status.
      Returns:
      Status, an enum represents the game status

    • getBoard

      int[][] getBoard()
      Get the board array.
      Returns:
      a deep copy of the board array
